intro: Erophila ozanoni, commonly known as the Ozanoni's erophila, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, orange, or yellow. The plant features slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
